tool.name: LowPassFilter

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input geophysical raster dataset for low-pass filtering.

param.name: cutoff_wavelength
param.dialogReference: Wavelengths shorter than this will be removed (noise removal). Typical values: 2000-10000 meters.

param.name: transition_width
param.dialogReference: Transition zone width to reduce ringing artifacts. Start with cutoff value and adjust as needed.

tool.summary: Remove short wavelength noise to enhance regional trends
tool.usage:
Low-pass filtering removes short-wavelength noise while preserving longer-wavelength features. This smooths data and enhances regional geological trends.

Applications:

• Noise reduction and data smoothing

• Regional trend enhancement

• Data preparation for interpretation

• Cross-survey leveling

Similar to upward continuation but provides more control over frequency response.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Low-pass filtering removes short-wavelength noise while preserving regional trends. Provides controlled data smoothing and noise reduction.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Noise reduction, data smoothing, and regional trend enhancement in geophysical surveys.
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Choose cutoff wavelength based on noise characteristics and desired smoothing level. Too aggressive filtering may remove geological signal.
